pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:0.5: 74. The training rule on defecating on cultivated plants
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were defecating, urinating, and spitting on cultivated plants. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.3.1: “‘When not sick, I will not defecate, urinate, or spit on cultivated plants,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.4: If one is not sick, one should not defecate, urinate, or spit on cultivated plants.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.5: If, out of disrespect, a monk who is not sick defecates, urinates, or spits on cultivated plants, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.11: if he does it in a place with no cultivated plants, but it then spreads to cultivated plants;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.14: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk74:1.15: The fourteenth training rule is finished.
